editorialSummary.text: Streamlined quarters, some with hill views, in a genteel hotel offering a rooftop restaurant/bar.

text.text:
I had the pleasure of dining at Fairfield by Marriott in Jaipur on the evening of 15th August, and I must say it turned out to be a truly memorable experience. The hotel had beautifully embraced the spirit of Independence Day, and the theme extended all the way to the buffet spread, a thoughtful and creative touch that instantly caught my attention.
We opted for the buffet dinner, and the variety on offer was impressive. There was a perfect balance of vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes, each prepared with care and packed with flavour. I especially appreciated how some of the dishes were inspired by the tricolour theme, not only did they look festive, but they also tasted wonderful. It was clear that the chefs had put a lot of heart into curating a menu that celebrated the occasion while delivering on quality and taste.
The ambiance of the restaurant added to the experience. The decor was elegant yet welcoming, and the Independence Day theme was tastefully incorporated without being over-the-top. What truly stood out, though, was the service. The staff was courteous, attentive, and genuinely warm, always checking in with a smile to make sure we had everything we needed. It’s the kind of hospitality that makes you want to come back.
Overall, it was a lovely evening filled with good food, a great atmosphere, and heartfelt service. If you’re in Jaipur and looking for a place that combines great dining with thoughtful presentation and impeccable service, I’d definitely recommend visiting Fairfield by Marriott. A big thumbs up for making this Independence Day dinner feel so special!

editorialSummary.text: Luxe rooms & suites, plus a serene spa, a fine dining restaurant & free breakfast.

text.text:
Shahpura House Hotel is a beautiful property with a traditional charm that truly stands out. The rooms are neat, spacious, and well-maintained, making our stay very comfortable. The rooftop restaurant is lovely and adds to the overall experience.

However, a few areas need improvement. The breakfast buffet was average, and the baked items such as croissants and donuts were below par. Our experience with the spa was also disappointing. Despite receiving a call from the spa, there was no male masseuse available in the evening. When we tried to book a session for my wife the following morning, we were told that no female masseuse would be available during those hours either, which was quite frustrating.

The valet service also requires attention. The staff often appeared disengaged instead of being attentive to guests.

On a positive note, the reception team was excellent — professional, courteous, and always ready help.

However, with a five star hotel status, we expected more from Shahpura House. Hence the 4 stars.

text.text:
I stayed at this property expecting a palace experience, but unfortunately, the service fell far below expectations.

We handed over the room keys at 12 noon requesting the room to be cleaned, only to return at 1 AM and find it in exactly the same condition—nothing was cleaned, toiletries were not replenished, and the room was left untouched despite clear instructions. This was extremely disappointing, especially considering the standard the property claims to uphold.

Even for small requests like cold drinking water, the response is painfully slow. Simple things that should have taken a few minutes stretched endlessly, making our stay frustrating.

The staff is humble and polite, and I appreciate that, but hospitality is not just about good manners; it’s about fulfilling basic guest needs promptly and efficiently, which this property failed to do repeatedly during our stay.

Overall, the place is beautiful, but the management seriously needs to improve their operational efficiency if they wish to provide a true palace experience to their guests.

text.text:
If you’re booking Radisson Blu expecting a true 5-star experience, you are likely to be very disappointed. It’s definitely not a 5 star. We stayed there from 15–17 August 2025 and almost every aspect fell short of what the Radisson name usually stands for.

The duty manager had promised a birthday cake and room decoration for our parents, ( had called
Him and spoken personally) but when we arrived, there was nothing. Even our rooms were kit ready even though we checked in way past the check in time.

The hotel itself feels tired. The entrance has an extremely small foyer with little charm, not impressive at all. The lobby has a seemed to have an artificial floral smell, and the overall look of the exterior and interior is dated and run down. Rooms are decently sized but lack any sense of luxury. Peeling paint, stains, and even loud plumbing noises that sounded like a drill machine made the stay uncomfortable.  They don’t feel too clean.

Service was equally underwhelming. Check-in at reception was delayed and inefficient. Breakfast was overcrowded and poorly managed, and the lobby-level restaurant was painfully slow with à la carte orders. Small but important details were overlooked, such as no iron in the room (though there was an ironing board), towels not replaced during service, and only very limited TV channels available.

On the positive side, room service was comparatively quick and the room size was comfortable. But overall, the hotel does not measure up to a 5-star standard. At best, it feels like a mid-range property trading on the Radisson name rather than delivering the experience guests expect.

text.text:
We loved our stay here at Golden Tulip, Jaipur. Friendly staff, prompt service, clean, spacious rooms, and amenities make this one of the best in Jaipur.
Very good breakfast buffet, was not a big fan of the dinner buffet for the price, but they also offer al a cart menu which you could order from. Asif was super helpful attending to our housekeeping needs and laundry.
they have 24 hour room service, so was able to get coffee/chai at 5am 😊

text.text:
I had one of the worst experiences during my 3-day stay at this hotel. The staff’s behavior was completely unprofessional, rude, and careless — definitely not what you expect from a place that calls itself a hotel. Instead of making guests feel comfortable, they act as if they are doing a favor by even responding.

The service is painfully slow. Their so-called breakfast is a nightmare — you’ll have to wait nearly 2 hours just for the simplest items, and when it finally arrives, it’s cold and poorly prepared. It’s better to step out and eat elsewhere rather than waste your morning waiting here.

Rooms and amenities don’t make up for the pathetic service. Overall, the entire stay was a disappointment from start to finish. They absolutely deserve the worst review possible. Avoid this place at all costs.

One of the best hotels in Jaipur. I have stayed at other hotels in Jaipur like Hyatt and lemon tree, but i think this was one of the finest hotel experiences that I have had in this city. Right from the check-in till check-out the staff was courteous and helpful at each point. The cleanliness of rooms were exquisite and the housekeeping staff was really prompt. I must mention the food of the hotel which was a highlight of my trip as I took all my meals in the hotel itself which was a delightful experience, the breakfast spread was good and had lots of vegetarian options. Overall, if you are looking to stay near the city and looking for top-notch amenities with a customer centric experience you can go with this hotel.

I hope the hotel team and staff will maintain this experience and I look forward to my next visit soon.

text.text:
We stayed for two days at pride amber villas and the property was magical. The moment we entered the resort, we were mesmerized with the beauty, the hospitality, cleanliness and the lush green views. They were kind enough to help us with our luggage. They dropped us to our room. The room was spacious and came with all the amenities. We also went to the pool which was again very clean. We had the best experience at the resort and can't wait to visit again.
If you need a stay away from the hustle bustle of the city and want to experience some peace and quiet with lots of greenery, you should definitely book this property.

The resort itself is stunning – beautifully maintained grounds, spacious and well-kept rooms, and a relaxing atmosphere that instantly puts you at ease. Every corner seemed thoughtfully designed to ensure comfort and luxury.

The food was an absolute highlight of our stay. Every meal was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented, with a wide variety of options catering to different tastes. Whether it was breakfast, lunch, or dinner, each bite was a delightful experience.

What truly set this resort apart was the warmth and dedication of the entire team. They were always ready with a smile, quick to help with any requests, and genuinely cared about ensuring we had the best possible time.

We left with wonderful memories and a desire to come back as soon as possible. Highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a perfect mix of comfort, great service, and exceptional food.
Satya ji duty manager was very cooperative . Excellent staff

editorialSummary.text: Contemporary quarters, some with city views, in an upmarket hotel offering a spa, dining & a pool.

text.text:
This was my second stay at Four Points by Sheraton, Jaipur, and once again, it was a truly relaxing experience with my family. The hotel staff is extremely helpful and professional, making us feel welcomed and well taken care of throughout our stay.

We especially enjoyed the swimming pool, and my kid had a great time there. The complimentary steam bath and welcome drinks added an extra touch of relaxation to our visit. The property is well-maintained, neat, and clean, reflecting the high standards the hotel upholds.

The breakfast spread is impressive, offering almost everything one could ask for, from freshly cooked dishes to a variety of fresh juices.

Overall, I absolutely loved my stay and would highly recommend Four Points by Sheraton, Jaipur to anyone looking for a comfortable and enjoyable hotel experience.

text.text:
Far Below Marriott Standards - A Disappointing Stay
A property endorsed by Marriott sets a high bar for expectations, but our stay was utterly disappointing. The experience was marred by significant issues from start to finish.
Pros:
The breakfast and dinner buffet spreads were excellent.
The staff in the dining area were courteous and attentive.
Cons:
Poor Check-in: Greeted by unsupervised trainees who were inept at handling guests.
Health Hazard: The swimming pool was infested with pigeons, a major hygiene concern.
Neglected Facilities: The gym was unsupervised at 7:45 AM, and the club lounge coffee machine was unserviced at 10:30 PM.
Worn-Out Property: Our club room felt tired, and the entire building had a dilapidated feel, far from the quality expected of the Marriott brand.
The dining staff were the only saving grace. Management needs to urgently address the lapses in service, hygiene, and maintenance

text.text:
This property is far from a true five-star experience – at best, it's a premium three-star hotel.
There was absolutely nothing that reflected the Sheraton brand's reputation for world-class hospitality.

When someone books a five-star hotel, they do so for the premium experience – impeccable service, comfort, and attention to detail. Unfortunately, none of that was present here. The property felt more like a three-star hotel, and the service barely matched even two-star standards.

The room experience was particularly disappointing.
When we entered, we were greeted with excessive humidity, visible mold on the wooden furniture, and a general sense of dampness – clear signs of poor hygiene and maintenance. The room was much smaller than advertised – definitely not 300 sq ft – and the washroom was extremely cramped, around 25 sq ft at best.

We had to request a room change to the 7th floor, which was marginally better in terms of cleanliness. However, even this room had broken fixtures – the phone cord and tissue holder were damaged, the sink was unclean (attached photo), and we even spotted cockroaches in the washroom.

The grooming kit provided was of such poor quality that using the toothbrush caused gum bleeding. The glass shower enclosure was also unhygienic and poorly maintained.

Room service was equally frustrating.
Requesting even basic items like a water bottle took a minimum of 30 minutes – as if they were sourcing it from another planet. This level of service is completely unacceptable, especially at this price point.

The location is another drawback – the hotel is situated in a congested area, near coaching centres and lacks the ambiance one expects from a premium property.

At ₹7000 per night, this stay was simply not worth the money.
During our 3-day, 2-night visit, we did not experience anything remotely close to five-star standards. Thankfully, we hadn’t booked an extra night – we were just waiting to head back to Delhi.

Verdict: We do not recommend this property at this price. It fails to justify its rating and does not deliver the experience it promises.

text.text:
I booked this place expecting a *luxury boutique hotel* experience, but unfortunately, it was anything but that. The property felt shady from the moment I entered. The rooms were poorly maintained, with a constant unpleasant smell that made the stay very uncomfortable. Cleanliness and hygiene were a big concern; the bathrooms and linens did not feel properly cleaned, which is unacceptable for any hotel, let alone one that markets itself as “luxury.”

What made things worse was the staff. Instead of being courteous and helpful, they were uncooperative and dismissive of even basic requests. Hospitality was completely missing, which is surprising in a city like Jaipur that is otherwise known for its warmth and service.

Overall, this hotel is *far from* what it claims to be. If you’re looking for comfort, hygiene, and good service, I’d strongly recommend looking at other options in Jaipur. This place was a huge disappointment and not worth the money.

✨ A Perfect Anniversary at Vijayran Palace – A Memory for Lifetime ✨

We booked a suite at Vijayran Palace to celebrate our wedding anniversary — and without a doubt, it turned out to be the best experience of my life so far.

From the moment we entered, everything — the food, staff behavior, prompt service, luxury facilities, hygiene, cleanliness, and the peaceful environment — was simply flawless. I would wholeheartedly give 10 out of 10 to each and every aspect.

Me and my husband truly thank Mr. Sumit from the bottom of our hearts for making our special day even more special.

Thank you, Vijayran Palace and the entire team, for gifting us memories we’ll cherish forever. 🌸

text.text:
This may be a great property going by the reviews, but the management mentality is quite pathetic i must say. If i could, i would give them negative stars.

I made a reservation for a 3 day stay at their property and within a couple of hours of doing so came down with a serious flu and high grade fever.

I requested them to make an exception to their 'no refund' policy on human and compassionate grounds by offering me a refund or at least a date change. But they just cold heartedly refused to budge and did not cooperate in anyway whatsoever.

Its my past experience that even though prestigious properties frequently publish their fares as non refundable online, they generally treat that as a guideline only and happily override it in genuine, human circumstances. They recognise the importance of treating people with respect, care and humanity while still protecting their interests.

But not Vijayran Palace. No trace of compassion, empathy or consideration for others on human grounds. Just pure, unadulterated greed and mindless parroting of 'policy'.

In the world that they inhabit - policies, which are meant to be guidelines, have become excuses to not use one's own brain and agency.

Disappointed. Id like to urge travellers to consider this - we all vote with our wallets. There are plenty of good properties but not many good people left in the world.

If we use our wallet to support properties that put care for people above blind and thoughtless pursuit of policy and pure greed, it would be one more way of making this world a better place.

Consider this, before booking your stay here. How we spend our money can make a difference in the world. Make it count.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Holiday Inn Express & Suites Jaipur and had a very pleasant experience. The hotel offers a warm welcome and the check-in process was smooth. The room was spacious, clean, and well-maintained, with all the basic amenities in place. The food quality was also impressive — tasty, fresh, and with good variety.

All the facilities like housekeeping, room service, and overall hospitality were really good. The staff was polite, helpful, and professional throughout the stay, which made the experience even better.

The only drawback was the Jacuzzi — it took almost 2 hours to fill and another 2 hours to empty, which made it difficult to use as expected. It definitely needs improvement in terms of functionality and convenience.

Other than that, everything was excellent. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a comfortable and enjoyable stay in Jaipur.

text.text: The HIE is located close to many of Jaipur’s beautiful sites. The first room we checked into was not as clean as expected and around 11pm the room next to us had their TV on full volume. We called the front desk and they immediately addressed the issue to our satisfaction. The next day the front desk manager called to apologize and shifted us into a better room as a courtesy! That was very much appreciated and showed us they valued us as customers. Overall we had a great experience because of the staff and service. Definitely would stay here again. Thanks Chef Santosh, Geetanjali, Suraj, and the rest of the staff for your great, friendly, attentive service!

text.text:
A Perfect Stay – Truly One of the Best Holiday Inn Experiences!

I don’t usually take the time to write long reviews unless something really stands out—and let me tell you, my stay at Holiday Inn Express & Suites Jaipur Gopalpura was nothing short of exceptional from start to finish. 🌟

From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with warm smiles and welcoming energy. The staff were incredibly kind, helpful, and genuinely eager to make my stay comfortable. Whether it was the front desk, housekeeping, or the restaurant staff, everyone I interacted with made me feel like a valued guest, not just a room number.

The hotel room itself was lovely—modern, clean, and thoughtfully designed. The bed was cozy, everything was spotless, and the amenities were just right for a relaxing and enjoyable stay. The space felt fresh, stylish, and well taken care of.

But what really took my breath away was the pool area. 😍 Wow! It’s like an oasis in the city. Peaceful, clean, and beautifully maintained. Whether it was early morning or sunset, spending time by the pool made me feel like I was on a mini vacation within my vacation. It’s definitely one of the highlights of the property.

This hotel struck the perfect balance between comfort, efficiency, and warmth. I have absolutely nothing negative to say—and that’s rare! My experience here reminded me of why I love the IHG brand, and this particular property raised the bar even higher.

If you’re thinking about staying here, don’t hesitate. Whether you’re in Jaipur for business or pleasure, the Holiday Inn Express & Suites Jaipur Gopalpura will treat you right.

Highly recommended. I’d come back in a heartbeat. ❤️

text.text:
Exceptionally bad service! Any requests made to guest services took about an hour and was done after 2-3 reminders. Service at the all day dining is unbelievably slow! Food is average. In room dining orders took close to an hour. We had to cancel an order of kulcha as it took more than 40 mins to be sent and by then the food was cold!
I truly have never seen a 5 star hotel with such bad service.

The duty manager at the time of check in, Angad, is someone who effortlessly can make a good day go bad and from there, to worse, for the guests. Zero sensitivity as to how to handle guests in a tough situation. No presence of mind! I have never seen a hospitality professional who is so determined to be rigid!!

However, 2 people definitely need special mentioning.
1- Abhishek Sinha, the duty manager, was truly one of the few people who made a difference. He effortlessly sorted the situation that his colleague Angad had turned worse. So, thank you Abhishek!
2 - Inderaj at the coffee shop, a team member with hearing disability, was truly exceptional with his service!

Lackluster service, truly feels like there's lack of well trained staff. The only good thing about this hotel is that the rooms were nice.

It was a rainy and cloudy day, well we started badly, when I asked for something to eat they brought it to me but right at night I started to vomit not only me but my family too and ate .I mean they had also eaten from there right at that moment, well I also asked for a thermometer to check the fever and they said you didn't have their food. It's a super bad room with no windows to open and  Unbearable smell. I only say this so you don't go to this place, it's the worst. If you go, just ask for something good and healthy to eat and have a good time. Good morning, good afternoon, and good night. :D

text.text:
Absolute nonsense hotel wanna gice negative star but google aint allowing me.

I had one of the worst dining experiences of my life at Palace Hotel Jaipur. What was supposed to be a pleasant meal turned into an absolute nightmare.

Firstly, they served me rotten food. I ordered Paneer Butter Masala, and the paneer was clearly spoiled—sour, rubbery, and totally inedible and was prepared atleast 12 hours before served to us. It was obvious they either don’t care about food hygiene or are cutting corners in the worst way possible. Serving rotten paneer veggie in Jaipur’s heat is not just disgusting—it’s dangerous.

As if that wasn’t bad enough, they refused to turn on the air conditioning despite the sweltering heat. They made me sit in a separate restaurant area, not the main one, which was basically a an oven where the AC barely worked (if at all). I have no idea why I was treated differently, but the main dining area was clearly better maintained—and I was kept out of it for no reason.

Absolutely no sense of hospitality, cleanliness, or customer service.
Avoid this place at all costs. There are plenty of better hotels and restaurants in Jaipur that actually respect their guests.

text.text: It’s the hotel for corporates, it’s absolutely perfect in every way. The staff and everyone is super helpful and prompt in their services. The rooms are comfortable & clean. 100% recommended 👍

originalText.text: It’s the hotel for corporates, it’s absolutely perfect in every way. The staff and everyone is super helpful and prompt in their services. The rooms are comfortable & clean. 100% recommended 👍

text.text:
We stayed in the Superior King Room Category. Our experience was delightful. We reached before time and got the room without much wait before the check-in time. We requested a room with a nice city view which was also acknowledged by the property.
The rooms are well maintained and bedding is comfortable.
The breakfast is delicious and lots of variety (I was actually amazed).
The highlight is Jaipur Local Cafe at the rooftop with beautiful panoramic views of Jaipur city. Happening vibe for partying and nice food. You don't require to go outside and lookout for any cafe...it's pretty much best in town.
Overally my stay was good and I would recommend all if you plan to book your stay at the property.
There is some renovation work going on at the moment but it's not at all a deal breaker. Rather one would not even notice. Property has hidden it very well and maintained proper hygiene and cleanliness.
The only issue I noticed was pigeon around the pool. I preferred not to use it because of that. This issue should be looked at and corrected.

What made my experience unforgettable was the exceptional service I received from Disha. Her remarkable memory and attention to detail made me feel genuinely valued as a guest. She went above and beyond to ensure everything was flawless, and it’s rare to come across such dedication and warmth.

This hotel is truly a gem, and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Jaipur. I cannot wait to come back again!

-good WiFi

CONS
-breakfast was good but a bit small and cramped

text.text:
**Review for Shahpura House**

My experience at Shahpura House was nothing short of exceptional, marked by their excellent hospitality, captivating ambience, and delightful breakfast buffet.

**Hospitality:**

From the moment I arrived, the staff exhibited a high level of professionalism and warmth. They were consistently courteous, attentive, and ready to assist with any needs. The personalized service made me feel truly valued as a guest, with every detail carefully attended to.

**Ambience:**

The ambience of Shahpura House is breathtaking. The hotel's architecture and interior design reflect a rich cultural heritage, with intricate decor and elegant furnishings that create a regal and serene atmosphere. The property is beautifully maintained, offering a peaceful retreat with lush gardens and charming courtyards that invite relaxation.

**Breakfast Buffet:**

The breakfast buffet was a culinary delight, offering a wide range of options to suit all tastes. The spread was diverse and appetizing. The quality of the food was outstanding, with fresh ingredients and carefully crafted flavors. The presentation was equally impressive, adding to the overall dining experience.

In summary, Shahpura House provides a perfect blend of traditional charm and modern comfort. The exceptional hospitality, stunning ambience, and delicious breakfast buffet make it an ideal choice for a luxurious and memorable stay. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a unique and enriching experience.

text.text:
Fellow Seattle Traveler,

Words truly fall short when trying to capture the beauty and warmth of Shappura House.
This hotel is not just a place to stay—it’s an experience that touches the heart in the most unexpected ways.

We came from out of the country, hoping to see Jaipur, but what we found was so much more. From the very first moment we arrived, Paresh, the incredible hotel manager, made us feel like family. His kindness, his patience, and his willingness to go above and beyond for us—whether it was helping us with tourist bookings, giving the most thoughtful recommendations, or sharing little-known insights—was simply extraordinary. It felt like we had a guardian angel during our stay, someone who truly cared, and that is something we will never forget.

The staff at Shappura House were equally remarkable—every smile, every small gesture of care, made us feel safe and welcomed in a way that’s hard to put into words. It was as though they had opened the doors of their home and their hearts to us.

Of course then there’s the hotel itself—Shappura House is breathtaking beyond belief. Walking through its doors feels like stepping into a dream, a world where time slows down and the grandeur of Rajasthan’s royal past comes alive around you. Every corner is a testament to beauty and history—ornate details, rich colors, and an atmosphere that makes you feel as though you’ve been transported to a palace in another era. It is truly a heaven on earth, a place where you can’t help but feel like royalty.

The rooms were pristine and spacious, with stunning palace decor that immerses you in a world of elegance and grace. Yet, they’ve seamlessly blended modern comforts—the bathrooms are thoughtfully designed, offering a luxurious shower and bathing experience that leaves you feeling refreshed and pampered.

Shappura House is not just a hotel—it’s a feeling, a memory etched deep in our hearts. It is the soul of Jaipur wrapped in warm hospitality, beauty, and love. To Paresh and the entire team: thank you from the bottom of our hearts for making our stay so special. We will carry these memories with us always.

text.text:
Delightful Dining Experience at Radisson Blu Jaipur Restaurant!

I recently visited the restaurant at Radisson Blu Jaipur and had a truly memorable culinary experience. From the elegant ambiance to the exceptional food quality, everything reflected the premium standards you expect from a five-star hotel.

The restaurant interiors are beautifully designed — spacious seating, warm lighting, and a calm atmosphere that makes you feel instantly relaxed. The staff was extremely courteous, well-trained, and attentive throughout the meal. Right from greeting us at the entrance to helping us with menu recommendations, the service was flawless.

Coming to the food — we opted for the buffet, and it exceeded our expectations in every way. The spread was extensive, covering a variety of Indian, continental, and Asian dishes. The live counters added a fresh touch, especially the pasta and chaat stations. Every dish was well-prepared, presented beautifully, and rich in authentic flavors.

The desserts section was another highlight — with multiple options including cakes, Indian sweets, fresh fruits, and ice creams. The quality of ingredients was evident, and the hygiene standards were top-notch.

For those preferring à la carte, the menu also offers a wide variety of gourmet dishes, and the chefs are happy to customize spice levels based on your taste.

Whether you're planning a family dinner, a business lunch, or even a special date night — the restaurant at Radisson Blu Jaipur is an excellent choice. The pricing is reasonable for the quality and experience offered. I would highly recommend it for anyone looking to enjoy a fine-dining experience in Jaipur.

text.text:
I had the pleasure of staying at Radisson Blu Jaipur, and it exceeded all expectations. From the moment I arrived, the hospitality was warm, professional, and genuinely welcoming. The check-in was smooth and quick, and the staff ensured I felt comfortable right away.

The room was spotless, spacious, and elegantly designed, offering a perfect blend of luxury and comfort. The bed was incredibly cozy, and the city views from my window added a special charm to my stay. Housekeeping was prompt and attentive, making sure everything was immaculate throughout.

The buffet breakfast was a highlight—a delightful spread of Indian and international dishes, with fresh fruits, live counters, and excellent coffee. Every meal felt thoughtfully prepared with attention to detail.

Special shoutout to the front desk team and restaurant staff for their courteous service. They were always ready to help with a smile, whether it was travel guidance or in-room requests.

The location is perfect, close to the airport and major city attractions, yet peaceful enough for relaxation. Whether you’re traveling for business or leisure, Radisson Blu Jaipur offers a top-notch experience.

Highly recommended—this hotel truly delivers the signature Radisson experience with a touch of Rajasthani warmth and elegance. Will definitely stay here again!

A perfect place away from the city chaos. No view as it is located in a residential locality but the service here is top class. The staff is amazing and the housekeeping services are on top notch, they have cleaned and made up the room various times throughout the stay.

Location - 2-3 km from hawa Mahal & main markets(but you have to cross the crowded market). Google map is 100% accurate. There are many restaurants nearby.

Parking - You have to leave your car keys at reception because the indoor car parking is limited.

Pool - it's operating, small but it's clean and well maintained. Also covered from birds and other dust. Located in basement.

Restaurant - it has fine dining restaurant.

Rooms - Rooms are big and has all amenities like fridge, kettle, hair dryer, bathroom flip flops, and other toiletries. V ry beautiful designs and traditional decorative lights makes it super awesome. Loved the metal lamps and other stuff in lobby and over the roofs. Loved our stay!

text.text:
This property is far from a true five-star experience – at best, it's a premium three-star hotel.
There was absolutely nothing that reflected the Sheraton brand's reputation for world-class hospitality.

When someone books a five-star hotel, they do so for the premium experience – impeccable service, comfort, and attention to detail. Unfortunately, none of that was present here. The property felt more like a three-star hotel, and the service barely matched even two-star standards.

The room experience was particularly disappointing.
When we entered, we were greeted with excessive humidity, visible mold on the wooden furniture, and a general sense of dampness – clear signs of poor hygiene and maintenance. The room was much smaller than advertised – definitely not 300 sq ft – and the washroom was extremely cramped, around 25 sq ft at best.

We had to request a room change to the 7th floor, which was marginally better in terms of cleanliness. However, even this room had broken fixtures – the phone cord and tissue holder were damaged, the sink was unclean (attached photo), and we even spotted cockroaches in the washroom.

The grooming kit provided was of such poor quality that using the toothbrush caused gum bleeding. The glass shower enclosure was also unhygienic and poorly maintained.

Room service was equally frustrating.
Requesting even basic items like a water bottle took a minimum of 30 minutes – as if they were sourcing it from another planet. This level of service is completely unacceptable, especially at this price point.

The location is another drawback – the hotel is situated in a congested area, near coaching centres and lacks the ambiance one expects from a premium property.

At ₹7000 per night, this stay was simply not worth the money.
During our 3-day, 2-night visit, we did not experience anything remotely close to five-star standards. Thankfully, we hadn’t booked an extra night – we were just waiting to head back to Delhi.

Verdict: We do not recommend this property at this price. It fails to justify its rating and does not deliver the experience it promises.

text.text:
The starting experience was a bit shaky - A lot of rooms were getting ready, leading to a 15-20 min delay in checking in. (A bit of feedback here - Please inform the guests on this reasoning).
Once checked in, everything about my stay was seamless, welcoming, and truly memorable. The property is beautiful, well-maintained, and perfectly located—but what truly elevated my experience was the warmth and professionalism of the staff.

I want to give a special shoutout to Pallabi Pore at the front desk, who went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. Her courteous demeanor, and genuine care for guests truly stood out. Pallabi embodies the spirit of hospitality, and she’s a true asset to the Sheraton team.

The rooms were spotless, the amenities top-notch, and the breakfast spread was excellent. Every interaction with the staff reinforced the high standards of service this hotel upholds.
The team (Pallabi Pore) allowed for complimentary bed for my 10 year old son. Even after that, the room was extremely spacious. Full marks to the room.

Highly recommend staying here—whether for business or leisure. Looking forward to returning soon!

✨ A Perfect Anniversary at Vijayran Palace – A Memory for Lifetime ✨

We booked a suite at Vijayran Palace to celebrate our wedding anniversary — and without a doubt, it turned out to be the best experience of my life so far.

From the moment we entered, everything — the food, staff behavior, prompt service, luxury facilities, hygiene, cleanliness, and the peaceful environment — was simply flawless. I would wholeheartedly give 10 out of 10 to each and every aspect.

But what made our experience truly unforgettable was our anniversary celebration. We had the pleasure of coordinating with Mr. Sumit for the arrangements, and to our surprise, he and his team didn’t just meet our expectations — they exceeded them in every possible way.
What we imagined turned into something even more magical, all thanks to their efforts. 💖

Me and my husband truly thank Mr. Sumit from the bottom of our hearts for making our special day even more special.

Thank you, Vijayran Palace and the entire team, for gifting us memories we’ll cherish forever. 🌸

The large and well appointed buffet breakfast room had an extensive breakfast to suit literally all major taste preferences.  I would say this is oke of the best value hotels I have stayed in around the world. The location is not central but you couldn't get this quality at this price in any town centre. I think this is a kind of Holiday Inn trade off because it's like this in other countries I have visited. Bravo, Holiday Inn! Well done !

text.text:
The Intercontinental Hotel in Jaipur stands as a bastion of hospitality, where every facet, from the immaculate rooms to the culinary delights, is meticulously curated to perfection. The meticulous attention to cleanliness pervades every corner, ensuring an ambiance of unparalleled refinement. Each facet, be it the culinary offerings or the sanctity of hygiene protocols, resonates with an ethos of perfection.

However, amidst this constellation of excellence, there shines a guiding star, Phileo, the epitome of a front desk manager. His demeanor, an oasis of tranquility amidst the tempest of inquiries and demands, is a testament to his unparalleled professionalism. Despite the relentless tide of requests, his composure remains unscathed, his resolve unwavering. Phileo's grace and efficiency is unmatchable and is a beacon of inspiration, elevating the hotel experience to celestial heights.

Furthermore, Balbir's presence adds yet another layer of brilliance to the ensemble. His warmth and unwavering dedication mirror the ethos of hospitality ingrained within the Intercontinental's ethos. Ensuring that every guest's needs are not only met but surpassed with unparalleled care and attention.

Yet, the constellation of excellence extends beyond these luminaries. Sutapa, with her sweet demeanor and unwavering professionalism, navigated the tumultuous waters of management with unparalleled grace. Aabida, too, exhibited a commendable blend of poise and efficiency, her calm demeanor a soothing balm amidst the chaos.

Lastly, Abhishek, a paragon of dedication within the concierge service, exemplified the hotel's commitment to excellence. His composed demeanor and meticulous attention to detail ensured that every task was executed with the utmost care and precision.

Again, the exceptional service of individuals like Phileo and their esteemed colleagues that truly sets this establishment apart, transforming a mere stay into an unforgettable journey of luxury and grace.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of hosting a major conference at InterContinental Jaipur Tonk Road by IHG, and I can confidently say it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The hotel seamlessly blends contemporary luxury with the regal charm of Jaipur, creating an atmosphere that is both elegant and inviting.

A special thanks to Mr. Mukul Jangir, Ms. Tanvi Sharma, and Mr. Rakesh and his entire team for their outstanding support and professionalism. Their dedication ensured that every aspect of the event was handled flawlessly.

From the moment I arrived, the staff extended a warm welcome with impeccable hospitality that made me feel truly valued. Check-in was smooth and efficient, and I was escorted to a beautifully appointed room—spacious, spotless, and tastefully decorated with modern amenities and subtle Rajasthani touches.

The dining options were equally impressive. Whether enjoying the lavish breakfast buffet or a fine dinner at one of their specialty restaurants, the food was consistently delicious and thoughtfully prepared. The service was attentive, courteous, and never intrusive.

What truly stood out was the attention to detail—from the seamless event coordination to the personalized hospitality touches throughout my stay. The hotel’s location on Tonk Road is also ideal, offering easy access to both the airport and Jaipur’s key attractions.

InterContinental Jaipur is not just a venue—it’s an experience. I highly recommend it to anyone visiting the Pink City, whether for business or leisure. I look forward to returning soon!

text.text:
Nestled like a hidden gem in the heart of Jaipur, this accommodation is a delightful surprise. The rooms are not just aesthetically pleasing, but remarkably spacious, surpassing even the standards set by most 5-star hotels. What truly stood out was the lavish bathroom equipped with a bathtub, a generously sized shower area, and an expansive walk-in wardrobe, exuding a sense of opulence.

There is a stunning pool and a sprawling garden, perfect for hosting events and gatherings which added an extra dimension to the experience. The immaculate cleanliness maintained throughout the premises further amplified the regal feel, making one feel as if they were residing in a modern-day palace.

The warmth and attentiveness exhibited by the staff were commendable, consistently tending to guests' needs with a sense of genuine hospitality that deserves recognition and appreciation.

While the property may be located at an hour's drive from the city center, its self-sufficient restaurant offers a diverse culinary experience, catering to a variety of tastes and preferences. Although the immediate surroundings lack external attractions, this very seclusion contributes to an atmosphere of unparalleled tranquility, providing an ideal retreat from the city's clamor. Without a doubt, a return visit is already on my agenda.

While the property may be located at an hour's drive from the city center, its self-sufficient restaurant offers a diverse culinary experience, catering to a variety of tastes and preferences. Although the immediate surroundings lack external attractions, this very seclusion contributes to an atmosphere of unparalleled tranquility, providing an ideal retreat from the city's clamor. Without a doubt, a return visit is already on my agenda.

text.text:
I stayed at Ramada by Wyndham Jaipur for two nights during my visit to the Pink City. Here are my impressions of the hotel:

## Location

The hotel is located in the city center, about 10 minutes' drive from Jaipur Airport and 15 minutes from Jaipur Junction railway station. It is also close to some of the main attractions of the city, such as Jal Mahal, City Palace, and Hawa Mahal. The hotel offers free parking, either underground or outdoors, and can arrange airport shuttles and day trips at the tour desk.

## Rooms

The hotel has 108 non-smoking rooms, fitted with air conditioning, wooden flooring, a 40-inch LED TV, a minibar, a coffee/tea maker, a desk, a safe, slippers, a hair dryer, and bath products. The rooms are spacious, clean, and comfortable, with a sitting area and a city view. The hotel also has different types of suites and club rooms that offer additional amenities and services, such as fruit platters, complimentary minibar, snacks, discounts on F&B and spa, and access to the club lounge.

## Facilities

The hotel has a rooftop outdoor pool that overlooks the Aravalli Hills, a gym, a spa, a business center, and ample event space. The pool is open from September to March and has a bar that serves Italian dishes and drinks. The gym is well-equipped and the spa offers various treatments and massages. The business center has computers, printers, and internet access. The event space can accommodate up to 500 guests for meetings, weddings, or parties.

## Dining

The hotel has two restaurants and two bars. Sunflower is the main restaurant that serves a free buffet breakfast of Indian and continental dishes. It also offers lunch, dinner, and 24/7 room service. Liquid Ice is a cozy bar that serves continental and Indian cuisine, as well as alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. VUE is the rooftop bar that operates from September to March and offers Italian appetizers and entrées. The club lounge is exclusive for club room guests and serves tea/coffee and snacks.

## Service

The hotel staff are friendly, helpful, and professional. They provide 24-hour front desk service, concierge service, dry cleaning and laundry service, and daily housekeeping. They also assist with travel arrangements, luggage storage, currency exchange, car rental, and ticketing. They are attentive to the guests' needs and requests and make sure they have a pleasant stay.

## Overall

I enjoyed my stay at Ramada by Wyndham Jaipur. It is a modern, comfortable, and convenient hotel that offers good value for money. It has everything you need for a business or leisure trip to Jaipur. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to explore the city's culture and history.

text.text:
**The Fern Habitat Jaipur: A Green Haven in the Heart of the Pink City**

Nestled within Jaipur's vibrant cityscape, The Fern Habitat emerges as a tranquil haven that seamlessly blends luxury with sustainability. Surrounded by lush greenery and serene ambiance, the hotel offers guests a serene escape from the bustling streets of the Pink City.

Each aspect of The Fern Habitat reflects a commitment to eco-conscious practices, from its energy-efficient lighting to its water-saving fixtures and sustainable materials. The accommodations, spacious and elegantly furnished, provide a comfortable retreat for guests, showcasing the hotel's dedication to both comfort and environmental responsibility.

The hotel's exemplary hospitality ensures that guests feel pampered and well-cared for throughout their stay. From the warm welcome at check-in to the personalized assistance offered by the attentive staff, every interaction reflects a genuine commitment to guest satisfaction.

Dining at The Fern Habitat is a culinary delight, with a restaurant offering a delectable selection of regional and international cuisine crafted with locally sourced ingredients. The hotel's amenities, including a refreshing swimming pool and a rejuvenating spa, further enhance the guest experience, inviting travelers to indulge in relaxation and well-being amidst the verdant surroundings.

Overall, The Fern Habitat Jaipur stands as a green oasis in the heart of the Pink City, inviting guests to embrace sustainability without compromising on luxury. Whether seeking tranquility or adventure, The Fern Habitat promises an unforgettable stay steeped in comfort, hospitality, and environmental stewardship.

Our wedding at Fern The Habitat Hotel was a flawless affair, and we owe it all to the exceptional team led by Sandeep Naruka, Happie Ji, Himanshu Jaiswal, and Ravi Tiwari. Their meticulous organization and management skills made every moment of our celebration truly magical. A heartfelt thank you to Kajal and Balkishan Ji for their invaluable contributions in finalizing the perfect venue.

The room service was nothing short of exceptional, with a prompt response within 5 minutes of every call. The suites, spacious and beautifully adorned, provided a sense of luxury and comfort, all while maintaining a pristine level of cleanliness. The culinary offerings were a highlight, with each dish being a delightful journey for the taste buds.

What set Fern apart was the round-the-clock availability of the reception staff. Their unwavering support and hospitality ensured that every guest felt welcomed and attended to. Our wedding experience at Fern The Habitat Hotel surpassed all expectations, leaving us with cherished memories. Highly recommend for a celebration that is both flawless and unforgettable.

text.text:
Immersive Culture with Unmatched Comfort:

Staying at Chokhi Dhani Jaipur was a captivating blend of tradition and modern comfort. The resort recreates the essence of Rajasthani village life, and the Mela adds a festive vibe to the evenings with local performers, magicians, and village-style rides.
We were in awe of the detail and authenticity. The food was another standout, with an array of traditional dishes that were packed with flavor.

Their Presidential Suites were the epitome of luxury, with interiors fit for royalty and a private pool that made our stay even more special.

Chokhi Dhani offers a unique mix of cultural experiences and high-end luxury, making it one of the best places we’ve stayed at.
